oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Economic Decision Analysis of Control Strategies for Anaplasmosis in Beef Herds
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Lehenbauer, Terry W.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: anaplasmosis control program
beef cattle
no control program
medication during vector season
vaccination
Economic decision analysis
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The purpose of this study was to evaluate the relative economic merits at the herd level of various anaplasmosis control programs for beef cattle in Oklahoma. Economic decision analysis techniques will be used to compare three basic alternative strategies: 1) no control program; 2) medication during vector season; 3) vaccination.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1998; 226
